results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Travellin' round
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Film Australia and Tourism Australia
results.brief_description: A girl and a boy in a Landrover, a motorcyclist and a continent. These are the most essential ingredients of a travel film with a difference, showing the beauties and splendours of Australia. Featuring Tom Burstall, Adam Plate, Ingrid Tantu, Lloyd Sutton, Susan Hannaford. Music and lyrics by Michael Carlos and Judy Henderson.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Film Australia and Tourism Australia

results.title: A Steam train passes
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Anthony Buckley and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A nostalgic essay on one of the majestic but now retired C38 class steam locomotives filmed on one of its final journeys from Sydney to a series of country railway stations. The film opens with a 1943 Cinesound newsreel depicting the track trials of the first of the C38 engines. The original soundtrack provides the only commentary.

results.title: Shades of Puffing Billy
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Puffing Billy miniature railway runs between the towns of Belgrave and Emerald in the Dandenong Mountains of Victoria. Supported and operated by amateur railway enthusiasts, with the assistance of the Victorian Government Railways, the Puffing Billy has become famous throughout Australia. Takes a light-hearted look at the problems of operating the railway. An affectionate salute to the people who keep this little railway running and to locomotive enthusiasts everywhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Antonio Colacino, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Paddington lace
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, David Bairstow and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Paddington is one of Sydney’s oldest suburbs, which has developed somewhat along the lines of New York’s Greenwich Village or London’s Chelsea and has become Sydney’s artist colony. This is a fully dramatised film, which captures the essence of Paddington, not only by striking visuals of the Old-Sydney architecture in the area, but by re-enacting the mood and lifestyle of some typical, bohemian inhabitants. Scripted by Joan Long. Music by Grahame Bond and Rory O’Donaghue. Starring Ross Thompson, Janne Wesley and Ron Blanchard.

results.title: One weft double cloth
results.creator_credit: James Coffey, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Described by its maker as an art film about art, ‘One Weft Double Cloth’ explores the work of three Australian artist through a progression of film images. It shows in direct visual terms the inter-relationship between the artists, their craft, and their environment. The work of blacksmith Marcus Skipper, weaver Mona Hessing and potter Peter Travis is seen through a poetic overlay of images in which is seen simultaneously the artist, the emerging artefact and the creator’s eye symbolising the preconceived goal to which he or she is working. The film itself reflects the craftsmanship of Larry Wyner who manipulated up to eight separate film images in creating the necessary optical effects. Complementing and supporting Wyner’s work is an original music score by Les Dempsey.

results.title: Icarus
results.creator_credit: Antonio Colacino, Don Murray, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Film Australia and Outlook
results.brief_description: Man, it seems, has long craved to fly as the birds fly, silently propelled only by the forces of nature. Some get towed aloft in large gliders; others, like flying men harnessed to flimsy wings, launch themselves from wind swept cliff tops. Icarus is a view of both forms of the gliding sport in which the viewer gains the same sense of freedom, of elevation above the problems of the earthbound as do the men who choose to gain recreation in this exciting way. No spoken commentary.

results.title: A Man's life is his own affair
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
An office-worker participates in a demonstration and his face is recognised by management in a front page newspaper photograph. Deals with the responsibilities of an employee towards his employer versus his rights as a citizen. Is a man free to do as he pleases outside working hours provided that it does not adversely affect his work?

results.title: You and Your Vote
results.creator_credit: Loch Townsend, Douglas White, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: In an attempt to overcome informal voting in Senate elections, an account is given of the work of the Electoral Office and the correct way in which a vote should be recorded.

results.title: Workout
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of the relationship between horse and rider during a work out. To compete in Olympic equestrian events young riders must practice daily, sharpening their own skill and that of their horses. Shows the world as it must appear to horse and rider on a foggy morning in the Australian bush.
